instruction: Extract the information relevant to the Q-Channel interface handshake mechanism, specifying rules for the following signals: QREQn, QACCEPTn and QDENY. Do not include signal behavior during reset.

Extract the information relevant to the Q-Channel device reset mechanism, specifying rules for the following signals: RESETn, QREQn, QACCEPTn and QDENY. Focus on how the reset signal affects other signals.
Extract information relevant to the P-Channel interface handshake mechanism, specifying rules for the following signals: PREQ, PQACCEPT, PDENY and PSTATE. Do not include signal behavior during reset.

Extract information relevant to the P-Channel device reset mechanism, specifying rules for the following signals: RESETn, PREQ, PQACCEPT, PDENY and PSTATE. Focus on how the reset signal affects other signals.
Extract the information relevant to the channel master/slave handshake process, specifying rules for the following signals: VALID, READY, and INFORMATION.
Extract the information relevant to the reset requirements, specifying rules for the following signals: ARESETn and VALID.
Extract the information relevant to the low-power handshake mechanism, specifying rules for the following signals: CSYSREQ and CSYSACK.

Extract information relevant to the handshake protocol of classic bus cycles, specifying rules for the following signals: STB_O, CYC_O, ACK_I, ADR_O, DAT_I, DAT_O, WE_O and SEL_O. Note that ERR_I and RTY_I are not supported for our implementation.
Extract information relevant to the reset operation of classic bus cycles, specifying rules for the following signals: RST_I, STB_O and CYC_O.
Extract information relevant to the write and read transfers, specifying rules for the following signals: PADDR, PSEL, PENABLE, PWRITE, PWDATA, PREADY and PRDATA.
Extract information relevant to the transaction termination mechanisms, specifying rules for the following signals: FRAME#, IRDY#, TRDY#, STOP# and DEV_SEL#.
